programme.title: JAG: Survivors
programme.desc: In a civilian court Harm represents a divorced (and emotionally baffled) Marine colonel, who has gotten into trouble over an unauthorized visit with his minor son.

programme.title: JAG: Recovery
programme.desc: A Navy astronaut dies during a drill while preparing for a space mission to repair a satellite.

programme.title: JAG: Prisoner
programme.desc: Chicom agents capture Harm in Hong Kong; they vigorously question him in mainland China about official matters.

programme.title: JAG: Ares
programme.desc: Someone kills a Naval officer on Okinawa, then his ship encounters major trouble during war games at sea.

programme.title: JAG: Skeleton Crew
programme.desc: The body of a woman Naval officer, a friend, and classmate of Harm, is found ashore.

programme.title: JAG: Trinity
programme.desc: Harm and his new partner, Marine Major Sara MacKenzie are drawn into a game of revenge when they're sent to Belfast, Ireland, to represent the legal interests of a Navy Lieutenant whose infant son has seemingly been abducted.

programme.title: JAG: Secrets
programme.desc: Admiral Chegwidden, Mac and Bud Roberts are taken hostage in the Admiral's office by Pvt. Magida, a Marine who escaped from a nearby Federal prison.

programme.title: JAG: Ghosts
programme.desc: Harm and Mac investigate an attempt on Admiral Chedwiggen's life and uncover the fact that all the members of his former SEAL team have died under mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: JAG: Full Engagement
programme.desc: While on their day off, Harm takes Mac for a flight in his vintage airplane, only to be forced to make an emergency landing in a mountain clearing because of mechanical problems.

programme.title: JAG: Cowboys and Cossaks
programme.desc: Harm, Mac, and Bud are assigned sea duty to monitor a joint war games exercise between U.S. and Russian naval forces.(n)

programme.title: JAG: The Guardian
programme.desc: Harm and Mac defend Bauwer, a former Navy Seal, now a homeless man, who's accused of using excessive force when he killed three men who tried to hold up a convenience store.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: It Isn't the Fall That Kills You
programme.sub-title: It Isn't the Fall That Kills You
programme.desc: When Walter is accidentally launched into space in a rocket, he hallucinates about Paige as his oxygen runs low, and Team Scorpion works feverishly to find a way to bring him home before he suffocates.

programme.title: Scorpion: It Isn't the Fall That Kills You
programme.sub-title: It Isn't the Fall That Kills You
programme.desc: When Walter is accidentally launched into space in a rocket, he hallucinates about Paige as his oxygen runs low, and Team Scorpion works feverishly to find a way to bring him home before he suffocates.

programme.title: Scorpion: Little Boy Lost
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must find a boy from Ralph's class who goes missing on a field trip after he accidentally has a run-in with a deadly criminal. Also, Toby gets closer to finding out the identity of Happy's husband.

programme.title: Scorpion: Plight At The Museum
programme.desc: Team Scorpion's simple job at the Los Angeles Natural History Museum turns deadly when they discover thieves robbing a rare gem exhibit in order to get materials needed to enrich a nuclear bomb.

programme.title: Scorpion: Bat Poop Crazy
programme.desc: Before Halloween, Team Scorpion must infiltrate a deep, vast cave system in order to prevent a bat population from destroying the North America ecosystem.

programme.title: Scorpion: We're Gonna Need a Bigger Vote
programme.sub-title: We're Gonna Need a Bigger Vote
programme.desc: On Election Day, as democracy hangs in the balance, Team Scorpion is called on when someone tries to throw the U.S. presidential election into chaos.

programme.title: Scorpion: Sly And The Family Stone
programme.desc: When Team Scorpion travels to Ireland for Megan's one-year memorial, Walter discovers that a nearby lake's natural disaster has created a poisonous cloud that could kill everyone in the village.

programme.title: Scorpion: Mother Load
programme.desc: Paige's estranged mother calls on Team Scorpion when she accidentally uncovers a forgotten nuclear reactor on the verge of exploding.

programme.title: Scorpion: This Is The Pits
programme.desc: Walter must swim through the deadly La Brea Tar Pits when Team Scorpion helps a woman trapped in the tar before she runs out of oxygen.

programme.title: Scorpion: Wreck The Halls
programme.desc: It's Christmas Eve and Team Scorpion's electronics-free mountain getaway turns deadly when they come across gun-runners, and Ralph is kidnapped when they try to escape.

programme.title: Scorpion: Ice Ca-Cabes
programme.desc: When a mission in the desert results in exploding shrapnel that seriously wounds Cabe, Team Scorpion must freeze his body in order to save his life.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: Faux Money Maux Problems
programme.desc: When Team Scorpion is duped into producing counterfeit money for a foreign entity intent on ruining the U.S. economy, Paige must rely on her mother Veronica's skills as a grifter to save them.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: The Hole Truth
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must save a man teetering on the edge of a massive sink hole that threatens to destroy the Los Angeles water supply forever.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Deal with the Devil
programme.desc: In the midst of a chaotic day at the station, Oliver prepares Andy to defend herself at Duncan’s dismissal hearing, now happening two hours from now.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Exit Strategy
programme.desc: Chris’s addiction issues come to a head when an innocuous call to a middle-class home puts Dov and Chris in the middle of a suspicious home invasion investigation.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Exit Strategy
programme.desc: Chris’s addiction issues come to a head when an innocuous call to a middle-class home puts Dov and Chris in the middle of a suspicious home invasion investigation.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: "Moving Day"
programme.desc: 15 Division is assigned to a community outreach program, “Moving Day”, to help tenants move out of a subsidized-housing complex that’s being torn down.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Fragments
programme.desc: Andy’s former rookie, Duncan, is back on duty and looking to reconcile – something she’s not ready for yet. But personal feelings get thrust aside when a bomb explodes in a downtown parking garage.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Everlasting
programme.desc: The officers of 15 Division work to track down TED MCDONALD (the car-bomber from Ep. 510). But even after catching him, they realize Ted has more targets set to explode out there. The clock is ticking.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Open Windows
programme.desc: Andy is attacked by an intruder at Traci’s place and the Sex Crimes Unit steps in to take over the case their way, 15 Division will have decide whether to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Perfect Family
programme.desc: Andy’s ideas about what makes a perfect family are put into perspective when she meets an out-of-control teen who needs to be protected from her own conservative family.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Uprising
programme.desc: A riot breaks out at a women’s correctional institute while Andy, Juliet, Nick, and Gail are there to transfer prisoners. They end up in a lock-down situation that finds Andy and Juliet trapped with a woman desperate to prove her innocence.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Letting Go
programme.desc: When Nick’s estranged older brother emerges with new information on someone from their tragic past, Nick goes off the grid to track the man down. But Juliet is hot on his heels, and Nick is forced to let her into the secrets of his past.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: A Real Gentleman
programme.desc: When Traci is a no-show for her first raid, 15 Division fears the notorious gun dealer they’re after has kidnapped her. But when Andy realizes that the serial rapist we never caught is back, it’s all hands on deck to find Traci.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Home Run
programme.desc: After a community-outreach baseball game erupts in a drive-by shooting, Gail’s relationship with her brother is put to the test . Meanwhile, Swarek plans a getaway with Andy up to Oliver’s cabin, which goes off the rails in every possible way.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Best Man
programme.desc: Andy and Sam are shocked to learn that Oliver is the prime suspect in IA’s corruption investigation into 15 Division. They only have until end of day today to find Chris Klem – the missing explosives-dealer – and clear Oliver’s name.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt2
programme.desc: The main hanger of Doncaster Air Museum is a vast building and houses flying aircraft of every kind. Stuart ventures alone and soon realises something is there with him.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Dorchester Prison 2 P1
programme.desc: Said to be the Most Haunted prison in the UK, HMP Dorchester is a scary place to be with a group of people but alone it becomes terrifying. Karl investigates the upper cells and gets more than he bargained for.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Dorchester Prison 2 P1

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Dorchester Prison 2 P2
programme.desc: Stuart enters the underbelly of this remarkable building and starts to witness some very strange occurrences.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Walton Hall
programme.desc: The Most Haunted team visit a gem in the Cheshire countryside where a disembodied voice brings disarray to the investigation and something in the cellar fills Yvette with fear and dread.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Whittingdon Castle
programme.desc: The ghost of a drowned soldier awaits Yvette and her team of paranormal experts as they tackle the hauntings that plague this once magnificent castle.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Abbey House Museum
programme.desc: Yvette introduces a brand new Most Haunted team member, Watson, a bulldog. This location starts to give up its mysteries as soon as the team arrive and they have go film differently to accommodate a particularly aggressive poltergeist.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Ripon Prison
programme.desc: A small prison in Yorkshire gives a big impact when Yvette and her team attempt to stay the night. Although many inmates were released some are still locked up and they are not happy.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Ripon Workhouse
programme.desc: In a place where the homeless were kept and work was hard, death was often the only escape but it seems that wasn’t the way for some as their souls are said to roam this place.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Standon Hall Part 1
programme.desc: Yvette Fielding and her team take on a three-part investigation that tests them to the very core. A place that surprised intrigued and terrified the hardened team, making Standon Hall the most fearful place they have investigated.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Standon Hall Part 3
programme.desc: The concluding part of the team’s most scary investigation to date, but will they last the night as something definitely wants them out.

programme.title: Most Haunted: The Slaughter House
programme.desc: The Slaughterhouse is Liverpool’s oldest pub and gives the team more than they bargained for as object are moved from underneath the team’s noses.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Todmoredon Church
programme.desc: For the first time Yvette takes her fearless Most Haunted team to an ordained church and graveyard. But it’s the cellar that proves the most fearful as the team get caught in a small room and they are not alone.(n)

programme.desc: Fuming over Froy's departure, Matt loses his temper on a dominatrix and her client and packs his bags to return to LA.? Down two repo men, the pressure is on Ronnie and Carlos, who interrupts a couple in the middle of their less-than-holy matrimony.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Bouquets and Blowtorches
programme.desc: The team returns from a successful mission in Vegas, but there's trouble brewing within the crew's ranks. Ronnie and Carlos repo from a self-defense instructor who lets his students do his dirty work.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Doomsday Prep
programme.desc: Matt and Froy struggle with language barriers when an Italian photographer and his assistant resort to violence because they can't comprehend. Will Sonia finally reveal what's happening, or will carrying her brother's burden get the best of her?

programme.title: Operation Repo: Sugardaddy Shakedown
programme.desc: The team wonders what's up with Sonia as she wrestles with Lou's big secret. Ronnie goes undercover and takes a gold-digging RO out on a date, but when Carlos lets the cat out of the bag all hell breaks loose.

programme.title: Operation Repo: The New Boss
programme.desc: Lou has retired, making Sonia the new boss, but will she be able to keep the company going without her big brother? Matt and Ronnie try to take a car away from a yuppie with an unusual taste for red meat.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Guy Code
programme.desc: In an effort to beef up their social agenda, Audrey persuades Jeff to double-date, which inadvertently puts the rules governed by the 'guy code' versus the 'marriage code' to the test.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Bag Ladies
programme.desc: Russell realizes the cost of dating a 'bag lady,' while Adam experiences the social peril of yielding to Jennifer's wishes and sporting a 'man bag.'.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Bag Ladies
programme.desc: Russell realizes the cost of dating a 'bag lady,' while Adam experiences the social peril of yielding to Jennifer's wishes and sporting a 'man bag.'.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Old School Jeff
programme.desc: Jeff is given an opportunity to 'live it up' during a night out on the town, landing Russell in hot water and Adam to reflect on the details surrounding his impending nuptials.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Fix-Ups and Downs
programme.desc: Jennifer and Audrey practice their match-making skills and inadvertently end up date-less while Adam and Jeff score financial gain in the process. Meanwhile, Russell tries a new tactic at 'fixing himself up.'.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: A Visit from Fay
programme.desc: A visit from Adam's free-spirited mother puts Jennifer's patience to the test and teaches Russell an embarrassing lesson about 'art'. Meanwhile, Jeff and Audrey find themselves enjoying alternative forms of entertainment.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Time Share
programme.desc: Jeff makes plans to take Audrey away for the weekend to a fancy hotel, even though they’ll have to sit through a time share presentation to get a great deal.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Jen at Work
programme.desc: Adam suggests that Jen do some freelance graphic design work for the company but Russell isn't crazy about the idea.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Optimal Male
programme.desc: Jeff's drive to be labeled an 'optimal male' on his life-insurance physical leads him to some extreme behavior, while Adam's over-friendliness with an ex-girlfriend unsettles Jennifer.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Russell's Father's Son
programme.desc: Russell puts on a show to impress his father when he comes to town, but both he and Adam learn the meaning of a parent's tough love. Meanwhile, an 'accident' in their apartment forces Adam and Jennifer to invade Audrey and Jeff's bathroom.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Buyer's Remorse
programme.desc: Jennifer and Adam attempt to practice fiscal responsibility as they consider buying their apartment. Audrey and Jeff offer to write their letter of recommendation, but end up making matters worse when they have a run-in with the landlady.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Pimp My Bride
programme.desc: Russell reluctantly agrees to host a photo shoot in his apartment for Audrey's magazine, with the hope of landing a date with a hot model. Adam steps in to play the groom in Audrey's wedding-themed shoot.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Jeff’s New Friend
programme.desc: Jeff is surprised when Audrey informs him that the new friend he made at the gym is gay. Meanwhile, Russell worries the young woman he's dating might be his daughter.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Voluntary Commitment
programme.desc: After a long line of female assistants, Russell learns that having a male assistant can be very advantageous. Meanwhile, after volunteering to read to the elderly, Audrey makes a bet with Jeff that she can commit to finishing a project.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Dad's Visit
programme.desc: Much to Audrey's dismay, Jeff's chauvinist father, who expects Audrey to wait on him hand and foot, extends his visit after spraining his ankle. Meanwhile, Russell has a one-night stand with a woman who won't leave his apartment.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Russell's Secret
programme.desc: Audrey discovers that Russell is a closeted fan of Broadway musicals, a fact she promises to keep secret in exchange for free theater tickets. Meanwhile, Adam and Jennifer take dancing lessons in preparation for their wedding.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Twice
programme.desc: When Audrey becomes jealous of a pregnant co-worker, she inadvertently convinces her colleagues that she has a bundle of joy on the way too.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Lyin' King
programme.desc: Things quickly get complicated when Audrey and Jeff decide to ditch a dinner date with Jennifer and Adam in order to attend Brad and Jackie's exclusive, celebrity packed party.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Family Style
programme.desc: When Audrey plans a dinner date with Jeff, Jackie (Guest Star Sam Harris) and Brad (Guest Star Orlando Jones), Jeff feels extremely violated when Jackie begins eating off his plate!

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Sex Toy Story
programme.desc: When Jennifer and Audrey throw a 'girls only' sex party, Jeff quickly gets insecure when he finds a 'product' Audrey may have purchased.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: House Money
programme.desc: When Jennifer and Russell decide to teach Adam a lesson in responsibility, the joke is on them when Adam has the last laugh.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: May Divorce Be With You
programme.desc: When Audrey invites her and Jeff's recently divorced out of luck friend Steve to stay with them for a few days, Audrey thinks she may have become Steve's newest rebound.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Poaching Timmy
programme.desc: When Timmy grows tired of dealing with Russell's demeaning demands and Audrey has had it with her terrible assistant, the two find a possible solution in working together. Meanwhile, Jeff tries to recreate the conditions that led to a Giants win.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Old Timer's Day
programme.desc: Jeff tries to prove to Audrey he's young and spry and invites her to watch him play softball. While up at bat, a simple sneeze throws his back out, but he insists on playing in the tournament game.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Three's Company
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district, moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Three's Company
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district, moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Strip Search
programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in. It's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Secret Places
programme.desc: When Leland learns that one of his clients with a reputation for stealing has lost her co-signer and could be ready to run, Dog and the crew hop a plane to the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Wrong Turn
programme.desc: Dog's target today seems to have a taste for drugs and a record of reckless driving. The hunt has deep emotional resonance for the team because today is the anniversary of the fatal car accident of Dog's daughter Barbara Katie.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Easy Rider
programme.desc: What looks like a routine pick-up turns into a complicated case of betrayal, deceit, as well as quality nail care as Dog and company track down a fugitive alleged to be an abusive boyfriend with one too many friends in his close knit community.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Midnight Run
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Hunt for Santa
programme.desc: Dog decides he needs to help his son Garry believe in Santa Claus again. So now the Dog, with a posse expanded to include his children and grandchildren, sets off on a hunt through the Colorado Rockies for Santa Claus himself!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Call Waiting
programme.desc: Dog's target for today has been in trouble with the law since he was a juvenile. And he seems willing to use any trick in the system to avoid capture by Dog. In this match of wits, will Dog prevail?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Kid Stuff
programme.desc: A fugitive from justice is on the lam and it's Dog's job to find him. When they hit the last known address they discover he already has pulled up stakes and left no forwarding address. The posse's one hope is to locate his girlfriend.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Easy Does It
programme.desc: There is a running joke in the posse that every time Bobby Brown asks them for help with a fugitive, he always promises them it's "an easy one," but the hunts end up being epic searches.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Dog believes in safety first, and today's hunt puts this philosophy to the test. The fugitive's problem with anger management increases the dangers of their already risky line of work. Dog warns the crew to be ready for anything as they head out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Back in the Hood
programme.desc: Today, Dog's bounty is about to take him on a trip down memory lane and test his investigative chops. With each lead propelling him closer and closer to his childhood haunts, Dog uses old-fashioned detective skills to track his prey.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: One for the Road
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out. He's also giving his nephew Justin a second chance to rejoin the team.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bait and Switch
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting. When the fugitive's girlfriend offers to help Dog trap this dangerous felon, Dog knows that someone is being deceived. The only question is, whom?(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: True Identity
programme.desc: Dog knows that looks can be deceiving. The fugitive is pretty, petite, and trouble. She stands accused of settling an argument with the help of a box cutter. What Dog does not anticipate is how deceptive this femme fatale can truly be!(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Secrets and Lies
programme.desc: What do you do when you have a fugitive you not only want to find, but believe can be helped back onto the straight and narrow? If you're Mary Ellen you call your good friend Dog.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Match Point
programme.desc: Duty calls and the Chapmans are off on a hunt. The team chases a fugitive who has disappeared into a world of "no known addresses.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: De-Bug Life
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home. Meanwhile, while the kids are running the church car wash, Si and Willie disagree on the best way to draw in customers.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Men vs. Wild
programme.desc: Brotherly competition is taken to a whole new level when Jase and Willie challenge Alan and Jep to a survival race through the woods on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Si is interested in finding a new hobby when he sees Kay cutting coupons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Men vs. Wild
programme.desc: Brotherly competition is taken to a whole new level when Jase and Willie challenge Alan and Jep to a survival race through the woods on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Si is interested in finding a new hobby when he sees Kay cutting coupons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Return of the Beavers
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Stumped on a way to celebrate Willie's birthday, Korie enlists the guys' help and Jase takes the reigns in planning a trip to the lake where Phil and Kay used to live. Meanwhile, the women realize a raccoon is inside the lake house.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Glory Is the Reward of Mallard
programme.sub-title: Glory Is the Reward of Mallard
programme.desc: When Willie takes a business trip to Scotland to expand his duck call business, he brings the entire family along so they can reconnect with their Scottish roots. Willie organizes a bus tour to trace his family heritage.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Good Night and Good Duck
programme.desc: A special holiday episode of Duck Dynasty shows when the Robertson family took over the Thanksgiving special of a local TV show "Good Morning Arklamiss." Each family member presents a special holiday segment, with Willie and Jase serving as anchormen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack in the Saddle
programme.desc: When Willie becomes the temporary owner of a thoroughbred, he and the guys take it to a local track and enter it into a race. Meanwhile, when Kay decides she wants to buy a new birdbath for her yard, she recruits Phil, Martin and Godwin.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: A Home for the Holidays
programme.desc: The Robertsons help a long time employee whose Mom has fallen on hard times by buying her a brand new house for Christmas. Jep, Jase, Martin and Godwin race to finish a deck in time for the big reveal, only to get sidetracked by a hammering competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Cannonball Runs
programme.desc: Jase enters an outhouse race to help promote Willie's Duck Diner, but when the Robertsons show up for the race, they face an unexpected rival - Phillip McMillan. Meanwhile, Willie attempts to create the world's greatest bologna sandwich.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Mo Math, Mo Problems
programme.desc: Willie helps Sadie with her homework by enlisting the guys to create a real-life version of a math problem, but when Jase and Willie get sidetracked helping Sadie, they rekindle an old argument of whether Jase can outrun a truck.

programme.desc: When Jep asks Willie and the guys to help move his old chicken coop into his new house, which is under renovation, Jessica takes issue with its appearance, leading the guys to yet another project - renovating the chicken coop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Friday Afternoon Lights
programme.desc: When Willie becomes an assistant coach on Lil' Will's struggling football team, his authority is tested when the kids challenge the adults to a scrimmage. Meanwhile, Kay brings Jep and Si to an aquarobics class at a local health club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Master and Duck Commander
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys transform an old pontoon boat into a floating duck blind, they are faced with the impending question of whether or not it will actually float. Meanwhile, Kay's dog Bobo misbehaves.

programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends. Meanwhile, Willie helps John Luke start his own snow cone business.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Flock and Key
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box. Meanwhile, Jase helps Mia prepare for her cheerleading competition, but the only problem is he has no idea.

programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all. Meanwhile, Si thinks his cat is cheating on him with another family, so he recruits Miss Kay.

programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind. Meanwhile, the ladies take a self-defense class and use John Luke as a punching bag.

programme.desc: When Willie and his brothers spend too much time frog hunting, their wives challenge them to a "frogging" competition.(n)
